text:
<@U016CGRMRAR> My business unit at IBM shifted to agile almost two years ago. I think agile makes sense for people who have never worked in an agency setting where there are deadlines and time sensitivities. In-house marketers are experts at what they do, but ruminate on details and “CYA” so much it delays publishing. Not all content fits neatly into sprints--especially video production and other long term assets. Overall positive for my colleagues who let things drag, but nothing new to me.

Content is accountable to a business unit Editor-in-Chief and Product Marketing org (classic matrix). My discipline (Content) is not a shared service since it’s considered critical for us to be in regular contact with Product. Our shared services include: web services, thought leadership, production, and digital strategy.
